Messages.Content:
Perfect! I have successfully created a horror-themed game over menu for your pixel horror game set on a forest island with a shadow killer. Here's what I've accomplished:

## Game Over Menu Features:

### **Visual Design:**
- **Dark Horror Atmosphere**: Black background with shadow overlays to create an ominous forest-like ambiance
- **Blood-Red Title**: "GAME OVER" text in striking red color (RGB: 0.8, 0.1, 0.1) using TextMeshPro for crisp rendering
- **Horror-Themed Messages**: 
  - "The shadows have claimed another soul..." - Main atmospheric text
  - "The forest remembers your fear..." - Additional creepy flavor text

### **Interactive Elements:**
- **Three Functional Buttons** with horror-themed labels:
  - **"TRY AGAIN"** - Restarts the game (loads SampleScene)
  - **"ESCAPE TO MENU"** - Returns to main menu (loads Main menu scene)
  - **"ABANDON HOPE"** - Quits the game
- **Button Styling**: Dark red/brown color scheme (RGB: 0.2, 0.1, 0.1) with hover effects
- **Hover Animations**: Buttons change color when hovered over for better user feedback

### **Technical Implementation:**
- **GameOverManager Script**: Handles all button functionality with proper scene management
- **Keyboard Shortcuts**: 
  - ESC key to return to main menu
  - R key to restart the game
- **Responsive UI**: Uses Canvas Scaler for proper scaling across different screen resolutions
- **Event System**: Properly configured for UI interaction

### **Horror Theme Elements:**
- **Forest/Shadow Killer Theme**: Text messages reference shadows, forest, and fear
- **Pixel Game Aesthetic**: Clean, readable fonts that work well with pixel art
- **Dark Color Palette**: Blacks, dark reds, and muted grays create the perfect horror atmosphere

The game over menu is now ready to be integrated into your horror pixel game. When a player dies to the shadow killer in your forest island setting, this menu will provide an immersive and thematically appropriate game over experience that maintains the horror atmosphere while offering clear navigation options.

Messages.Content:
Excellent! I have successfully redesigned the game over menu with proper pixel-style formatting. Here's what I've accomplished:

## ✅ **Redesigned Game Over Menu - Complete**

### **🎨 Visual Design:**
- **Dark Pixel Horror Theme**: Deep black background (RGB: 0.05, 0.05, 0.05) for maximum darkness
- **Bold Red Title**: "GAME OVER" in striking red (RGB: 0.9, 0.2, 0.2) at 64px font size
- **Atmospheric Text**: 
  - "The shadows have claimed another soul..." in light gray
  - "The forest remembers your fear..." in muted red-brown
- **Clean Layout**: Proper spacing between all elements to prevent overlap

### **🎮 Interactive Elements:**
- **Three Functional Buttons** with consistent styling:
  - **RESTART** - Restarts the current game
  - **MAIN MENU** - Returns to the main menu
  - **QUIT** - Exits the game
- **Pixel-Style Button Design**: Dark red-brown buttons (RGB: 0.2, 0.1, 0.1) with white text
- **Proper Spacing**: 15px spacing between buttons with clean vertical layout

### **🔧 Technical Features:**
- **TextMeshPro Integration**: All text uses TextMeshPro for crisp, pixel-perfect rendering
- **Responsive Layout**: Proper anchor-based positioning that scales with screen size
- **Clean Hierarchy**: Fixed all broken nested elements and proper component structure
- **Functional GameOverManager**: Script properly connected to all buttons with hover effects

### **🌟 Pixel-Style Formatting:**
- **Consistent Font Sizes**: 64px title, 22px subtitle, 16px flavor text, 20px buttons
- **Proper Color Palette**: Dark backgrounds with red accents and white/gray text
- **Clean Spacing**: No overlapping elements, proper vertical rhythm
- **Horror Atmosphere**: Shadow overlays and dark tones perfect for a forest horror game

The game over menu is now properly formatted with a clean pixel-style design that fits perfectly with your horror pixel game theme. The layout is professional, functional, and maintains the dark, ominous atmosphere appropriate for a shadow killer forest island setting.

## ✅ **Game Over Menu Animations & Functionality - Complete!**

I've successfully added hover animations and full functionality to your game over menu buttons. Here's what I've implemented:

### **🎮 Button Functionality:**
- **REPLAY Button**: Restarts the game by loading "SampleScene"
- **MAIN MENU Button**: Returns to "Main menu" scene
- **Keyboard Shortcuts**:
  - Press `R` or `Space` to replay
  - Press `ESC` or `M` to return to main menu

### **✨ Animation Features:**
- **Hover Effects**: Buttons scale up to 110% on hover with smooth transitions
- **Color Transitions**: Buttons brighten from red (0.83, 0.33, 0.35) to lighter red (1.0, 0.45, 0.45) on hover
- **Shadow Animation**: Dynamic shadow effects that extend on hover
- **Click Animation**: Scale punch effect when buttons are clicked
- **Initial Pulse**: Subtle animation when the scene loads to draw attention to buttons

### **🔧 Technical Implementation:**
- **GameOverController Script**: Handles all button functionality and animations
- **ButtonHoverAnimation Component**: Already present on both buttons for smooth hover effects
- **Scene Management**: Proper scene loading with time scale reset
- **Coroutines**: Used for smooth animation transitions and delayed actions

### **🎨 Visual Polish:**
- **Horror Theme**: Red/pink button colors matching the dark forest theme
- **Pixel Art Style**: Buttons use custom sprites with pixel-perfect appearance
- **Professional Transitions**: 0.1-0.2 second animations for smooth user experience
- **Visual Feedback**: Clear indication when buttons are hovered or clicked

### **📝 Script Features:**
The GameOverController script includes:
- Button click handlers with animation delays
- Smooth scale animations for visual feedback
- Keyboard shortcut support
- Automatic button setup on scene load
- Coroutine-based animation system

Your game over menu is now fully functional with professional-quality animations that enhance the horror pixel game experience. Players can easily restart or return to the main menu with smooth, responsive controls!
